p: The cellular oncotic pathways affected by flaxseed and its bioactive components include a modulation of estrogen metabolism [ 36], an inhibition of cellular proliferation, angiogenesis, metastasis and inflammation, as well as a stimulation of apoptosis within the tumour [ 36, 38, 41, 42, 43, 45, 46]. The molecular targets for the anti-tumour actions of flaxseed and its bioactive components include a suppression of the phosphorylation of p-AKT, p-ERK and p-JNK kinases (resulting in a general slowing of the MAPK pathways) [ 43, 46], inhibition of CDK4 [ 45], down regulation of multiple miRNAs [ 44], decreased expression of mRNAs for Bcl2, cell cycle proteins, ERalpha and beta and epidermal and insulin-like growth factor receptors [ 46].
